instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7022: What is R7022? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.C7020: What is C7020? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for charger current sensing, you should measure around 20.02 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing as much power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SCL: What is SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SCL? SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SCL is another way to say SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL, look at the definition provided for SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL as it applies to .
definitions.CHRG_AGATE: What is CHRG_AGATE? This is a typo of CHGR_AGATE When you see CHRG_AGATE, assume they meant to type CHGR_AGATE.
definitions.CHRG_BGATE: What is CHRG_BGATE? This is a typo of CHGR_BGATE When you see CHRG_BGATE, assume they meant to type CHGR_BGATE.
definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3115B: What is 820-3115B? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6529: What is ISL6529? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.SMC_BATLOW_L: What is SMC_BATLOW_L? SMC_BATLOW_L refers to a power management signal that indicates a low battery condition. The "_L" suffix suggests that this is an active-low signal, meaning that it becomes low when the battery reaches a low voltage threshold..
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.C9560: What is C9560? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2850 logic board that often dies and causes intermittent power to framebuffer PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS and PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R rail, causing GPU kernel panics. Replace with non-tantalum if machine is having random black screen or kernel panics.
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.5V_S0: What is 5V_S0? 5V_S5 is an abbreviation for “PP5V_S0”.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dim green light.
threads.message:
Ok so I got this with quarter fan spin and it went straight to dim green light after a few minutes of diode measurements. With just the charger plugged in. 
pp3v42 = 3.42
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 0.3v
Diode mode <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>=.489

<RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> pin1=2.4v [HR][/HR]<RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR> pins 1 & 2 in ohms = 1.965 k ohms
<RESISTOR>R7022</RESISTOR> pins 1 & 2 in ohms = 1.975 k ohms
<RESISTOR>R7022</RESISTOR> between pins 1 & 2 =0.1
<CAPACITOR>C7020</CAPACITOR> resistance on 1&2 =20ohms 

<CHIP>ISL6295</CHIP> (pins)27/28 20ohms
<CHIP>ISL6295</CHIP> (pins)17/18 2.9ohms
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> =3.3v

<TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> Pins 1-4=16.24v
<TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_INRUSH</SIGNAL> =2.59v

Tried with battery g3h=12.5v at fuse f7040

thank you for your time

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dim green light.
threads.message:
"3-<SIGNAL>CHRG_ACIN</SIGNAL>=1.5mv"
There should be aprox 4V.

"19-<SIGNAL>PP5V1_CHRG_VDD</SIGNAL>=6mv
20-<SIGNAL>PP5V1_CHRG_VDDP</SIGNAL>=6mv"
And 5V there.

So start checking diode mode (red probe at ground) on these points.
If nothing strange, then check <RESISTOR>R7010</RESISTOR>; could be open, because of corrosion.

"<RESISTOR>R7011</RESISTOR> =38ohms in circuit"

If works, you are lucky; not even need to change it.
If not, change <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>.

threads.message:
<CAPACITOR>C7011</CAPACITOR> is not critical, let it out.
But need to replace <RESISTOR>R7011</RESISTOR>, seems to be bad.
Or maybe broken/corroded trace.
You should get aprox 4V there.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dim green light.
threads.message: Good morning soo I replaced the <CHIP>ISL6529</CHIP> before I saw your comment. The isl was shorted on pin 3 now I have 3.9 at acin. The light was dim even after the change and now checking around the mosfet I heard a ?click? and the MagSafe light turned a normal green and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> had 12.5v then died again. Bad solder joint ? Or MOSFET ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dim green light.
threads.message:
"The isl was shorted on pin 3 now I have 3.9 at acin"
You had just a bad <CAPACITOR>C7011</CAPACITOR>.

Bad solders, or knocked off components around <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> could now generated more damage on the board.

Did you solder good <RESISTOR>R7011</RESISTOR>???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dim green light.
threads.message: Yes I did solder it well. I have 4v at the voltage divider. I tried without <CAPACITOR>C7011</CAPACITOR> it gave me 16v at pin3. I replaced it with another <CAPACITOR>C7011</CAPACITOR>. are you saying I switched isl 6529 for no good reason? :(

threads.message: I noticed <RESISTOR>R7086</RESISTOR> pin2 has 12v at <SIGNAL>CHRG_AGATE</SIGNAL> and Nothing on output <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_INRUSH</SIGNAL> at <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dim green light.
threads.message:
If ACIN went high removeing <CAPACITOR>C7011</CAPACITOR>, <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> was not the culprit.

"I have 4v at the voltage divider. I tried without <CAPACITOR>C7011</CAPACITOR> it gave me 16v at pin3"
This is very confuse.
You can only get 16V there if <RESISTOR>R7011</RESISTOR> is open, or not soldered.
<CAPACITOR>C7011</CAPACITOR> is not involved in voltage level; can only short to ground if bad.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dim green light.
threads.message:
I?m sorry for the confusion its me. I fixed some corrosion on the edge of the board that I hadn?t seen.  I have a solid green light on MagSafe  and I believe that isl is pulling <SIGNAL>CHRG_AGATE</SIGNAL> high to 15v because it might be seeing some over current at <SIGNAL>CHRG_CSIP</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>CHRG_CSIP</SIGNAL>.I noticed that at the mosfet upper mosfet by isl I have a weird fluctuation. So I removed f7040 put my power supply on 12v and placed it on pin 2 of f7040 so that should now rule out anything on isl as being an issue am I right? If not. I have still divided the system in half and know the issue is after pin2 on f7040
thank you 
2informatico

Be sure to have good solders!

Thank you your guidance help me find the culprit. I found the issue with fluctuations on g3h it was <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR>.

so now I?m back on the fan spinning for 20 sec and stopping the usb mouse and usb stick flash when the fan spins and stops when the fan stops. G3h is stable 12.53v  and 5v pulses with power on off

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dim green light.
threads.message:
If you hold the power button down when it is doing this, does it start up normally? 


My very first board repair would do this, and you held the power button down, and it would start normally, ended up being a bad ISL. 

Had another machine that would do this, and power on normally if the power button was held, and it was a short on a trackpad subrail. 

Try it and report results. If the same, check for a short on S0 and S3 rails.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dim green light.
threads.message:
If the USB stick flashes, means the board is working in that time.
Check if board stays on if you start in SMC bypass mode.
Be sure heatsink is properly fixed and CPU/GPU don't get overheat fast.

Had another machine that would do this, and power on normally if the power button was held, and it was a short on a trackpad subrail.

Try it and report results. If the same, check for a short on S0 and S3 rails.

This will likely suck. 

Recheck current sensing on pins 17/18 27/28 of the ISL should be 3-5 ohms / 20 ohms. 

Also, resistance to ground on CPU and GPU VCORE.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dim green light.
threads.message:
SMC batlow should go high with a battery or the use of a 85w charger. 4.9v isn't right. That is a 3.3v signal. Are your meter batteries low? 

That reminds me. Are you using a real 85w charger with this? 

When the fan spins, does <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> go high?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dim green light.
threads.message:
"the fan spinning for 20 sec"
Why do you talk about pulsing now?
I was waiting to get some voltages present in the 20s mentioned.
You cannot say pulsing when the board stays on 20s; unless you note some pulse in these 20s...

BTW, <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> shouldn't be related with this symptom, but it must be changed in any case.
So change it now, to discard it completely.
Do NOT use hot air for this!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dim green light.
threads.message:
im sorry What I meant was that the pulsing coincides with fan on and off or at the same time
the coils as I mentioned only showed a voltage L7330
it goes up to 3.3v then to zero. So when fan spins it at 3.3v when off it goes to zero the only other rail I found that does this is <SIGNAL>PPV1V5_S3</SIGNAL> and gets power from <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL> which isn?t pulsing on off it stays stable all the time.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dim green light.
threads.message:
If fan spins, <SIGNAL>5V_S0</SIGNAL> is needed.
PLEASE post accurate information.
There are more voltages present for sure.
To get <SIGNAL>5V_S0</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is required, as <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> too.

BTW, ALWAYS check coils voltage on the pin connected to filter capacitor.
